tool.name: Consensus sequence from aligned FASTA

param.name: input
param.label: Input fasta file with at least two sequences

param.name: method
param.label: Consensus method when differences are found between sequences

param.name: gaps
param.label: Take account of gaps?
param.help: /!\ If gaps are at the same place in all the sequences don't check 'no', you'll face an error

param.name: outog
param.label: Output consensus sequence AND original sequences in the FASTA file?
param.help: /!\ If gaps are at the same place in all the sequences don't check 'no', you'll face an error

tool.help:
===================================================== Get consensus sequence from several aligned sequences =====================================================
This tool uses the seq_consensus function from the bioseq package. @WARNING@ If gaps are at the same place in all the sequences don't check 'no' in the gaps parameter, you'll face an error
Input can be any fasta file containing at least two aligned sequences.
Output is a fasta file containing the computed consensus sequence (along with original sequences if you want to).
